netgear.securityNotes: Active bug bounty since 2017, CNA since 2019, regular security advisories, dedicated security response team

asus.securityNotes: CNA since 2024, regular firmware updates, publishes security advisories, responsive to responsible disclosure. Asuswrt-Merlin community firmware available for many models.

tplink.securityNotes: Bug bounty via HackerOne, firmware updates vary by model age, some legacy models discontinued quickly

dlink.securityNotes: 25+ KEV CVEs - most of any router vendor, many models EOL without patches, slow security response, limited transparency

zyxel.securityNotes: CNA since 2021, publishes security advisories, 12 KEV CVEs, some models EOL without patches

mikrotik.securityNotes: RouterOS receives regular updates, transparent changelog, 2 KEV CVEs from 2018, popular in ISP/prosumer market

draytek.securityNotes: Regular firmware updates, publishes security advisories, 3 KEV CVEs, responsive to researchers

tenda.securityNotes: Low-cost routers, limited security response, 3 KEV CVEs, firmware updates sporadic

ubiquiti.securityNotes: Bug bounty via HackerOne, regular firmware updates, 1 KEV CVE from 2010, active security team

xfinity.securityNotes: ISP-managed firmware, auto-updates controlled by Comcast, limited user visibility into security patches

verizon.securityNotes: ISP-managed firmware, multiple CVEs in older models, auto-update capability but not always timely

att.securityNotes: ISP-managed firmware, auto-updates controlled by AT&T, bridge mode available on some models

linksys.securityNotes: Regular firmware updates, some models have cloud management, owned by Fortinet (2022)

eero.description: Cloud-managed mesh WiFi systems with auto-updates

amazon.securityNotes: Amazon-owned since 2019, auto-updated firmware, cloud-managed, bug bounty through Amazon VRC

apple.securityNotes: DISCONTINUED PRODUCT LINE. AirPort was discontinued in 2018. Last firmware 7.9.1 released May 2019. No further updates expected. Strong security team but product is EOL.

nest.description: Google Home integrated mesh WiFi systems with auto-updates

google.securityNotes: Google-owned, auto-updated firmware, Thread/Matter support, strong bug bounty program

router.description: WiFi routers for Starlink satellite internet

starlink.securityNotes: SpaceX-owned, automatic firmware updates, bug bounty up to $100K. Popular for rural/remote internet. Auto-updates reduce user burden.

belkin.securityNotes: Foxconn subsidiary since 2018, limited security advisories, multiple CVEs without patches, poor vulnerability response

arris.securityNotes: CommScope acquired ARRIS in 2019, Motorola Home brand, multiple RCE vulnerabilities, hardcoded credentials in some models

buffalo.securityNotes: Popular in Japan and Asia, CVE-2021-20090 affected multiple models, some DD-WRT support, JVN advisories

actiontec.securityNotes: Primary OEM for ISP gateways, multiple CSRF vulnerabilities, backdoor accounts found in some models, firmware updates controlled by ISP

huawei.securityNotes: CNA since 2018, CVE-2017-17215 heavily exploited by Mirai, US government restrictions, active PSIRT

wavlink.securityNotes: CRITICAL: 63+ CVEs disclosed January 2025, vendor REFUSES TO PATCH. Remote root access via WAN, hardcoded credentials, command injection. DO NOT USE - replace immediately with secure alternatives.

xiaomi.securityNotes: CNA with HackerOne bug bounty, publishes security bulletins via Mi Security Center. CVE-2023-26317 through CVE-2023-26320 affected older routers. Some firmware only in Chinese initially.

gigacenter.description: ISP-provided ONT gateways - AVOID: 5 critical CVEs in 2025

calix.securityNotes: ISP gateway OEM. GigaCenter ONT line has 5 critical CVEs (Feb 2025) - CVE-2025-53913/53914/7635/54083/54084. Vendor stated EOL products will NOT be patched. GigaSpire line is newer. Firmware managed by ISP via Calix Support Cloud.

tomato.notes: Recommended for VPN and QoS features

netgear_r6400v2.displayName: NETGEAR R6400v2 AC1750 Smart WiFi Router

v2.note: Popular eBay item. CVE-2021-40847 RCE patched in 1.0.4.120. Update to 1.0.5.128 recommended.

legacy.eolNote: Multiple models affected - verify specific model EOL status

a1.note: EOL since 2024. CVE-2024-36755 SSL certificate validation flaw in firmware update process - NO PATCH. D-Link strongly recommends replacement.

default.note: Premium WiFi 6E tri-band mesh (2.4GHz + 5GHz + 6GHz). AXE8400 speeds up to 8.4 Gbps. 5Gbps WAN port, 4x Gigabit LAN, USB 3.0. 3000 sq ft coverage, 65+ devices. MX8501/8502/8503 are packaging variants (1/2/3-pack).

1.x.eolNote: No firmware updates since May 2022. Consider security implications for sensitive networks.

default.note: Budget WiFi 5 mesh router. Last firmware update May 2022 - nearly 4 years stale. Popular on eBay secondary market.

1.x.eolNote: CVE-2022-38132 command injection patched in 1.1.10. No updates since October 2022.

wavlink_ac3000.displayName: Wavlink AC3000 Gigabit Router - CRITICAL: DO NOT USE

all.eolNote: CRITICAL: 63 CVEs disclosed Jan 2025. Vendor REFUSES to patch. Remote root access via WAN. REPLACE IMMEDIATELY.

default.note: CRITICAL SECURITY RISK: 44 vulnerabilities, 63 CVEs found by Cisco Talos. Wavlink declined to release patches. Hardcoded credentials allow remote root access. DO NOT USE - replace with secure alternative.

wavlink_ac1200.displayName: Wavlink AC1200 Router/Extender - CRITICAL: DO NOT USE

all.eolNote: CRITICAL: CVE-2024-48705 command injection. No patch available. REPLACE IMMEDIATELY.

default.note: CRITICAL: Post-authentication command injection in password reset. Firmware M32A3_V1410_230602 and M32A3_V1410_240222 confirmed vulnerable. No patch. DO NOT USE.

wavlink_wn530h4.displayName: Wavlink WN530H4 Range Extender - CRITICAL: DO NOT USE

all.eolNote: CRITICAL: Stack buffer overflow + command injection. Remote code execution without auth. REPLACE IMMEDIATELY.

default.note: CRITICAL: CVE-2024-10194 (stack buffer overflow in login.cgi) and CVE-2024-10429 (command injection in set_ipv6). No user interaction required. DO NOT USE.

wavlink_wn530hg4.displayName: Wavlink WN530HG4 Range Extender - CRITICAL: DO NOT USE

all.eolNote: CRITICAL: Stack buffer overflow + command injection. Remote code execution without auth. REPLACE IMMEDIATELY.

default.note: CRITICAL: Same vulnerabilities as WN530H4. CVE-2024-10194 and CVE-2024-10429. No patch available. DO NOT USE.

wavlink_wn572hg3.displayName: Wavlink WN572HG3 Outdoor Extender - CRITICAL: DO NOT USE

all.eolNote: CRITICAL: Stack buffer overflow + command injection. Outdoor model - higher exposure risk. REPLACE IMMEDIATELY.

default.note: CRITICAL: Outdoor extender with same critical vulnerabilities. Higher risk due to external placement. CVE-2024-10194 and CVE-2024-10429. DO NOT USE.

wavlink_wn578w2.displayName: Wavlink WL-WN578W2 Range Extender - CRITICAL: DO NOT USE

all.eolNote: CRITICAL: CVE-2025-10323 command injection (January 2025). Remote exploitation. REPLACE IMMEDIATELY.

default.note: CRITICAL: CVE-2025-10323 command injection via sel_EncrypTyp parameter in wizard_rep.shtml. Remote exploitation possible. DO NOT USE.

calix_gigaspire_u4m.displayName: Calix GigaSpire Mesh BLAST u4m WiFi 6

isp-managed.eolNote: Firmware automatically pushed by ISP via Calix Support Cloud. Contact your ISP for firmware version.

default.note: WiFi 6 mesh satellite (2x2 MU-MIMO 2.4GHz + 5GHz). Works with GigaSpire BLAST u4 (GS2028E) hub. ISP-managed firmware - updates pushed automatically by service provider. Different product line from vulnerable GigaCenter ONTs.

ispGateway.ispNotes: Firmware managed by ISP via Calix Support Cloud. Consumer cannot manually update. Contact ISP for security concerns.

1.x.eolNote: WiFi 7 (802.11be) tri-band router. Codename RC06. No known CVEs at launch - new device.

openwrt.notes: WiFi 7 not yet supported in OpenWrt

default.note: WiFi 7 tri-band router (2.4GHz + 5.2GHz + 5.8GHz). 1GB RAM, Qualcomm quad-core. Chinese firmware interface - use Translate Mi extension. OTA updates via Mi Home app or web UI at miwifi.com.
